meanings.definition: To open or remove a seal from something.
meanings.sent1: Please unseal the letter carefully to avoid tearing it.
meanings.sent2: I need to unseal this jar of pickles to enjoy a snack.
meanings.sent3: After struggling to unseal the package, I found it was just a box of socks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to unseal a flood of memories from his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved unsealing a locked box without touching it.

meanings.definition: To reveal or disclose something that was previously hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The detective will unseal the evidence during the trial.
meanings.sent2: The treasure map will unseal the location of the hidden chest.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes always unseal a wave of laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her diary entries unsealed the depths of her emotions to the reader.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll unsealed the mysteries of the lost civilization.
